titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Raymond Laurel Lindeman Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Thomas J. Connors

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 10:07

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of correspondence, ecological writings, and research materials of Raymond L. Lindeman. The correspondence concerns his research work and publications. His writings and research are primarily devoted to the limnology of Cedar Creek Bog and Cedar Bog Lake in Anoka County, Minnesota. Also included are miscellaneous notes, essays and drawings by his wife, Eleanor Hall Lindeman.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Raymond Laurel Lindeman Papers (MS 815). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of G. Evelyn Hutchinson in 1971 and 1973; transferred from School of Forestry, 1999.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Raymond L. Lindeman Papers consist of 3.5 linear feet of correspondence, ecological writings, research notebooks and other research materials. Miscellaneous notes, essays and drawings by his wife, Eleanor Hall Lindeman, are also included.

The correspondence mainly concerns Lindeman's research, publications and institutional employers. A number of letters concern the initial rejection and eventual acceptance of Lindeman's article "The Trophic Dynamic Aspect of Ecology" by Ecology Magazine. The correspondence is arranged alphabetically by individual or organization.
The writings are mainly concerned with the limnology of Cedar Creek Bog and Cedar Bog Lake in northern Anoka County, Minnesota. They are arranged chronologically.
Notebooks and other research materials, which include photographs, charts and maps, follow the writings.
The Raymond L. Lindeman Papers were given to Yale University Library by G. Evelyn Hutchinson in 1971.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Raymond L. Lindeman received his Ph.D. from the University of Minnesota in 1941. He was a post-doctoral fellow at Yale associated with Professor G. Evelyn Hutchinson when he died in June 1942, His paper, "The Trophic-dynamic Aspect of Ecology," published posthumously by Ecology Magazine, is considered a classic in the field of environmental science.

list.item: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia , 1942
American Association for the Advancement of Science , 1939
P. Blakiston's and Son and Co., Inc. , 1938
Limnological Society of America (Paul S. Welch) , 1938-40

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.
